ygData.subject: RE: [EQ_Tinkering] Sigh...  Abashi responds...
ygData.msgSnippet: I took it when I read the statement about Tinkering being after Poison, that it was next, however, for now, I ll be content to wait and see what happens with
ygData.messageBody:
I took it when I read the statement about Tinkering being after Poison, that it was next, however, for now, I'll be content to wait and see what happens with tinkering in the next month or so.  The last few patches have brought about a lot of changes in various trade skills.  Many were merely fixes to things that were not working, but several have been additions.  One of these to smithing, allows the smith to create arrow heads, albeit for around the same cost as simply buying the arrow heads.  Their have been several things being done on test too, such as tinted armor, different types of armor, and some additions to tailoring (these I have tested myself).  I have also heard rumors of being able to craft enchanted items, such as weapons, but have not verified this myself.  Most of these new additions aren't really money sinks either (tinted armor may be).  I'm hoping this boasts well for the future of tinkering.  They are actively working on the upgrades and small things, and the person who they have doing it doesn't seem to be solely interested in creating a money sink, so it may very well be a good thing that tinkering has been put off.  Would you rather have a money sink implemented a couple months ago, or a viable usefull skill implemented next month?  I am also looking for an improvement to the fletching skill for my ranger, and a general upgrade to archery though I don't think the later will happen.
 
on Tarew Marr
Calador Stormblood  Ranger of the 35th circle
Fellmore Steinick  Gnome Magician of 20 seasons
 

This is Abashi, he leaves  way out for  everything he says or he will not
say it. So yes, he will use the excuse "after doesn't mean next".

On Thu, 31 Aug 2000, Kimes, Dean W. wrote:

>
> Whoa, now you are using semantics as an excuse?  If I'm a cashier and I tell
> you I'll help you after I help this other gentleman, do you really expect I
> might not get to you for several weeks?  I think not.  The general
> understanding when someone says something will be done after something else
> is that there is a sequence involved.  2 comes after 1.  No one believes
> that means 2 comes sometime after 1, but not necessarily next.
>
>       Leagnomo
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Joe D [mailto:joed@...]
> Sent: Thursday, August 31, 2000 11:08 AM
> To: EQ_Tinkering@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: [EQ_Tinkering] Sigh... Abashi responds...
>
>
>
> On Wed, Aug 30, 2000 at 02:50:45PM -0700, Gazamel Prime wrote:
> > I started up a thread on the Gameplay boards, and
> > Abashi actually answered it.  He is now saying that
> > Tinkering was never promised to us after poison, a
> > 100% contradiction of what Aradune stated earlier this
> > year.
>
> To be fair, he never did say what you attributed to him.
>
> You said that he said the tinkering would be done NEXT after poisoning.
>
> This is incorrect.
>
> All he said was that it would be done after poisoning, not IMMEDIATELY after
> poisoning.
>
> Be patient.  They'll get to it.
>
> Pasketti of Povar
>
>
>
>
>
